text: The Papyrus Chester Beatty VIII (also signed as P.Chest.Beatty VIII, VH 304, Rahlfs 966, LDAB 3084) is a fragment of a septuagint manuscript that contains parts of the biblical Book of Jeremiah. Palaeographically it has been dated to the late second, early third century CE. == Description == It was written in codex form on papyrus, in 48 lines per page. The text contains Jeremiah 4:30–5:1; 5:9–13; 5:13–14; 5:23–24. Turner dated the manuscript to the fourth century CE. This manuscript contains the contraction to represent the word κύριος, written in nomina sacra. === Location === Currently is saved in Dublin, at the Chester Beatty Library. == References == == Sources == * * * Category:2nd-century biblical manuscripts Category:3rd-century biblical manuscripts Category:4th-century biblical manuscripts Category:Septuagint manuscripts
title: Papyrus Chester Beatty VIII
